secret_rule: The item can be brought to the picnic only if its name is a single-word noun and contains the letter 'k'.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "kite" and "knife".

I'll make a strategic first guess that begins with the letter "K" like the previous allowed items.

I'll ask: "Can I bring a key?"

This guess follows the potential pattern of starting with the letter "K" while testing whether this might be the underlying rule.
Yes, you can bring a key.

Since my previous guesses of items starting with "K" (key) were successful, I'll continue testing this hypothesis while choosing a different K-word.

I'll ask: "Can I bring a kettle?"

This allows me to further explore whether words beginning with "K" are the secret rule, while using a new item not previously mentioned.
Yes, you can bring a kettle.

Based on the game examples and successful guesses, my rule hypothesis is:

The secret rule appears to be: Items that start with the letter "K" are allowed.

The evidence supporting this rule includes:
1. Initial game examples: "kite" and "knife"
2. My successful guesses of "key" and "kettle", both of which start with "K"

I'm confident this is the underlying rule of the game, as all allowed items consistently begin with the letter "K".

My final guess is: The rule is that only items starting with the letter "K" are permitted in the game.
